quest.name: Made to Order
journal: Though the Rose Knight cook seems exhausted, the fire in her eyes tells of work to be done.

The Rose Knight cook has prepared packed meals for the men and women of Camp Cloudtop. In her old age, however, their delivery proves more difficult than she would care to admit. Determined to see her hard work is not wasted, she asks you to distribute three sets of packed meals in her stead. Pick up the packed meals and prepare to make your delivery.
You pick up the three sets of packed meals. See them safely to the knights of Camp Cloudtop.
You have delivered all of the packed meals, garnering you many thanks for temporarily relieving the resident cook of her duties. Head back and speak with the Rose Knight cook.

Though she lacks the vigor to jump for joy, her look of gratitude is unmistakable as she conveys the pleasure she takes in preparing their meals. Though the thinner air of the Sea of Clouds is harsh in her old age, she assures you a meal cooked by their hands is equally unkind, vowing to continue to work so long as she is able.
objectives: Pick up the packed meals for delivery.
Report to the Rose Knight cook.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: Hello there, missyladdie. No doubt you've important work to attend to. Well, we all have a part to play. As a matter of fact, I should be handing out these meals, but these old bones don't move like they used to.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: But as I said, we all have a part to play. And I can't very well keep the good men and women of Camp Cloudtop waiting.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: I don't suppose you'd be willing to make a few deliveries in my stead, would you? The packages are clearly labeled. I can't offer much, but I will compensate you for your trouble.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: Bless your heart. They're stationed close by, so it shouldn't take you long. Pray hurryâ”€they're sure to be famished.

dialogue.name: LANIAITTE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. To what do I owe the honor of your presence this fine eveningmorningday?

dialogue.name: LANIAITTE
dialogue.text: A delivery from the cook? I was all but certain there would be none today. You have my thanks. And give her my best regards.

dialogue.name: LANIAITTE
dialogue.text: I know she means well, but please remind her that she needs to rest.

dialogue.name: MARIEL
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname. Can I help you with something?

dialogue.name: MARIEL
dialogue.text: Oh, a meal from the cook! Why did she not come herself? Well, no matter. My thanks to you both.

dialogue.name: MARIEL
dialogue.text: I know she thinks herself something of a maid, but she's really more like family. The camp wouldn't be the same without her.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: Whatever it is, make it quick. I cannot leave my post unattended for long.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: Oh! A meal from the cook! That she makes such fine cuisine from seemingly deplorable rations is nothing short of a miracle. Thank you, misssir. My compliments to the chef!

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: Love makes for the best seasoning. Give her my thanks for the fine meal!

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: Welcome back. I take it by your empty hands their meals have been delivered. Excellent. Short though the trip may be, a few fulms feel like malms at my age. Heh heh.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: It's worth it to see their smiling faces, though. I know they say I should take things easy, but age is no excuse for letting up on my duties.

dialogue.name: LUNCHCLERK01739
dialogue.text: I won't deny I've had second thoughts about staying, what with the thinner air here in the Sea of Clouds and all... But have you tried their cooking? No one should have to suffer such unsavory fare, and they won't so long as I'm here.
